verses.verse: Judah’s Song of Victory (Isa 4.2; 12.1; 14.31; 60.18) On that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city; he sets up walls and bulwarks as a safeguard.
(Isa 60.11, 18; 61.3; 62.1, 2) Open the gates, so that the righteous nation that maintains faithfulness may enter in.
Those of steadfast mind you keep in peace, in peace because they trust in you.
(Isa 12.2; 17.10) Trust in the LORD forever, for in the LORD GOD (Heb in Yah, the LORD) you have an everlasting rock.
(Job 40.11-13; Isa 25.12) For he has brought low the inhabitants of the height; the lofty city he lays low. He lays it low to the ground, casts it to the dust.
(Isa 3.14, 15; 28.3) The foot tramples it, the feet of the poor, the steps of the needy.
(Isa 42.16; 57.2) The way of the righteous is level; straight is the path of the righteous that you clear.
(v 13|ISA 26:13; Ex 3.15; Isa 51.4; 56.1) In the path of your judgments, O LORD, we have placed hope; your name and your renown are the soul’s desire.
(Ps 63.6; Isa 55.6; Hos 5.15) My soul yearns for you in the night; my spirit within me earnestly seeks you. For when your judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
(Isa 22.12, 13; Hos 11.7; Jn 5.37, 38; Rom 2.4) If favor is shown to the wicked, they do not learn righteousness; they corrupt what is upright on the earth and do not see the majesty of the LORD.
(Isa 5.12; 9.7; 10.17; 66.15, 24) O LORD, your hand is lifted up, but they do not see it. Let them see your zeal for your people and be ashamed. Let the fire for your adversaries consume them.
(v 3|ISA 26:3; Isa 64.8) O LORD, may you ordain peace for us, for indeed, all that we have done, you have done for us.
(Isa 2.8; 10.11; 63.7) O LORD our God, other lords besides you have ruled over us, but we acknowledge your name alone.
(Isa 8.19; 10.3; Hab 2.19) The dead do not live; shades do not rise because you have punished and destroyed them and wiped out all memory of them.
(Isa 9.3; 33.17) But you have increased the nation, O LORD; you have increased the nation; you are glorified; you have enlarged all the borders of the land.
(Hos 5.15) O LORD, in distress they sought you; they poured out a prayer (Meaning of Heb uncertain) when your chastening was on them.
(Isa 13.8; Jn 16.21) Like a woman with child about to give birth writhes and cries out in her pain, so were we because of you, O LORD;
(Ps 17.14; Isa 33.11) we were with child; we writhed, but we gave birth only to wind. We have won no victories on earth, and no one is born to inhabit the world.

(Ezek 37.1-14; Dan 12.2) Your dead shall live; their corpses (Cn Compare Syr Tg: Heb my corpse) shall rise. Those who dwell in the dust will awake and shout for joy! (Q ms Compare Gk Syr: MT dust, awake and shout for joy!) For your dew is a radiant dew, and the earth will give birth to those long dead. (Heb to the shades)
(Ex 12.22, 23; Ps 30.5; Isa 54.7, 8; 2 Cor 4.17) Come, my people, enter your chambers, and shut your doors behind you; hide yourselves for a little while until the wrath is past.

(Job 16.18; Isa 13.11; Mic 1.3; Jude 14) For the LORD comes out from his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; the earth will disclose the blood shed on it and will no longer cover its slain.
